intro: Stylocoryna bispinosa, commonly known as the two-spined stylocoryna, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are covered in small, sharp spines. Stylocoryna bispinosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
